questions.question_text: Which command configures console port authorization under line con 0?

discussion.content:
Create a named authenttication list, lets call it CONSOLE;

Switch(config)#aaa authentication login CONSOLE group tacacs+ local

Create a named authorization list, again called CONSOLE

Switch(config)#aaa authorization exec CONSOLE group tacacs+ local if-authenticated

Then apply the following under line con 0;

Switch(config-line)#login authentication CONSOLE

Switch(config-line)#authorization exec CONSOLE

Since local is defined as the secondary method of authentication/authorization be sure to have a local privilege 15 user defined in the event your tacacs server isn't available.

Switch(config)#username MYUSERNAME privilege 15 secret 0 MYPASSWORD

choices.D: It is used for posture assessment, so the ISE changes the user profile based on posture result.
choices.A: It will return an access-accept and send the redirection URL for all users.
choices.B: It establishes secure connectivity between the RADIUS server and the ISE.
choices.E: It allows multiple users to authenticate at the same time.
choices.C: It allows the ISE to send a CoA request that indicates when the user is authenticated.

questions.question_text: When RADIUS NAC and AAA Override are enabled for WLC on a Cisco ISE, which two statements about RADIUS NAC are true? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Client root certificate is not included in the Certificate Store
choices.B: Certificate authentication profile is not configured in the Identity Store
choices.C: MS-CHAPv2-is not checked in the Allowed Protocols list
choices.A: EAP-TLS is not checked in the Allowed Protocols list

discussion.content: Policy---Policy Elements---Results---Authentication---Allowed Protocols: See if all allowed protocols are checked

questions.question_text: Changes were made to the ISE server while troubleshooting, and now all wireless certificate authentications are failing. Logs indicate an EAP failure. What is the most likely cause of the problem?
Which two switchport commands enable MAB and allow non-802.1X capable devices to immediately run through the MAB process? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Allowing of web browser activex installation

questions.question_text: What are two client-side requirements of the NAC Agent and NAC Web Agent installation? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: I dont think C is a correct answer. You don't need administrator privileges for Web Agent.
